headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; Geographical Society--STATISTICAL SECTION. HEAVY ROBBERTY OF SILKS. Police Intelligence. Fires. Coroner's Inquest.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Statistical Section of the Geographical Society met on Thursday evening, in the Society's room at the University, Rev. Dr. HAWKES in the Chair, Rev. Dr. ADAMSON Secretary. ARCHIBALD RUSSELL, Esq., Chairman of the Counell, read a suggestive report. In it he observed that, fortunately for statists, the opinion is strongly gaining ground that nothing ?? like figures.

docs.snippet: JOHN B. ROBFRSON, late Cashier of the Eagle Bank at Rochester, is on trial in that city on a charge of conspiring against the life of his wife. The case excites great interest in Rochester, where the parties are well known, and have always occupied a...

headline.main: The Robertson Trial at Rochester--A Remarkable Case.

docs.lead_paragraph: JOHN B. ROBFRSON, late Cashier of the Eagle Bank at Rochester, is on trial in that city on a charge of conspiring against the life of his wife. The case excites great interest in Rochester, where the parties are well known, and have always occupied a highly respectable position. The circumstances are of unusual character.

headline.main: FROM ALBANY.; Court of Appeals' Calendar--Proceedings in the House--and no Proceedings in the Senate. SENATE NEW-YORK LEGISLATURE.

docs.lead_paragraph: The following numbers will be called in the Court of Appeals on the 10th: Nos. 39, 40, 41, 32, 63, 30, 50, 58, 67, 23, 44, 49, 60, 439, 12, 16, 65, 18, 34, 43, 47, 48. The House passed three additional hours ostensibly engaged in an effort to effect an organization. At the opening it was evident we were to have a departure from the regular order of things.

headline.main: Late and Important from the Utah Expedition.; Gov. Cumming's Proclamation, and his Letter to Brigham Young. Preparation of the Mormons to Leave in the Spring. Concentration of the Troops in Winter Quarters.

docs.lead_paragraph: Last evening we received intelligence from the Army, at fore Bridger, and from the Territory of Utah, and proceed to give the news, which is a highly interesting character. The whole of the troops sent out upon this expedition have been concentrated, and were at the date of out last accounts, in Winter quarters on Black's Fork, about one and a quarter miles above Fort Bridger

headline.main: THE NATIONAL AGRICULTURAL CONGRESS.; Sixth Annual Meeting of the United States Agricultural Society.

docs.lead_paragraph: An auspicious sun and large attendance of members, delegates from other societies, and members of Congress, combine to render the commencement of this sixth annual gathering of the United States Society full of cheerful promise. The growing influence of our National Agricultural Society is manifested by the character of the persons who attend its Washington meetings.
